meanings.definition: A mass of fine, light fibers or particles.
meanings.sent1: The peach had a soft fuzz on its skin.
meanings.sent2: I brushed off the fuzz from my sweater.
meanings.sent3: The kitten's fur was so fluffy, it looked like a fuzzball.
meanings.sent4: The dandelion seeds floated in the air like specks of fuzz.
meanings.sent5: The dust on the old book formed a layer of fuzz over time.

meanings.definition: A blurred or distorted image or sound.
meanings.sent1: The TV screen showed a fuzzy fuzz of colors.
meanings.sent2: The photograph was ruined by a strange fuzz around the edges.
meanings.sent3: The radio signal was full of fuzz, making it hard to hear the music.
meanings.sent4: Her memory of the event was just a fuzzy fuzz in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The fog created a mysterious fuzz over the landscape.

meanings.sent1: She tried to fuzz the details of the story to avoid trouble.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a soft brush to fuzz the edges of the painting.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to fuzz the truth only made the situation more confusing.
meanings.sent4: The mist started to fuzz the outlines of the trees in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The steam from the hot cup began to fuzz the mirror's reflection.

meanings.definition: To cover or become covered with fuzz.
meanings.sent1: The peach skin started to fuzz after a few days.
meanings.sent2: The caterpillar fuzzed the branch with its silky threads.
meanings.sent3: The blanket began to fuzz after being washed too many times.
meanings.sent4: The mold started to fuzz the bread left on the counter.
meanings.sent5: The flower petals fuzzed with pollen as the bees visited them.
